place.name: DURLEIGH
place.gazetteerText: DURLEIGH, a parish in Bridgewater district, Somerset; on an affluent of the Parret, 2 miles WSW of Bridgewater town and r. station. Post town, Bridgewater. Acres, 886. Real property, £1, 331. Pop., 158. Houses, 31. The property is subdivided. The living is a donative in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £25. Patron, G. R. Harding, Esq. The church is old but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
